description: The Tower of Justice is the tallest structure in Enies Lobby, located at the rear of the island behind the courthouse and across the drawbridge. It houses the offices of Spandam and the CP9 agents, and contains many floors with various rooms and secret passages.

keyEvents.description: Zoro and Kaku engage in an intense sword battle within the Tower.
keyEvents.significance: The Tower serves as the battleground for one of the arc's major fights.

keyEvents.description: Kaku's first Devil Fruit transformation as a full giraffe causes the floor to collapse, creating structural damage.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the Tower's vulnerability to the powerful battles taking place within it.

keyEvents.description: Kaku uses a devastating Rankyaku technique that vertically slices the entire Tower of Justice building in half.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the massive structural damage the Tower sustains during the CP9 battles, foreshadowing its eventual destruction.

statusHistory.description: The Tower is operational and serving as CP9 headquarters during the Enies Lobby arc.
The Tower sustains severe structural damage from Kaku's Rankyaku attack, being sliced vertically in half.

features: Underground tunnel to Bridge of Hesitation
The words 'Enies Lobby' displayed on the exterior
trivia: The Tower of Justice is also called the 'Tower of Law' in English versions.
An underground tunnel leads from the basement to the Bridge of Hesitation, allowing one to bypass the whirlpools.
The exact number of floors is unclear, as only select floors are shown in the series.
The Tower will eventually be completely destroyed along with the rest of Enies Lobby during the Buster Call.
